description: For much of his campaign to return to the White House, President-elect Donald Trump was facing four separate criminal prosecutions. Now that he’s won, prosecutors have dropped his two federal cases, and the two cases brought by states are in peril as well.
title: What’s Up With Trump’s Criminal Cases Now That He’s Been Reelected?

description: Colombian lawmakers reinstated spending limits intended to curb the cost of a controversial bill that boosts budget transfers to the country’s regions.
title: Colombia Reimposes Spending Curbs in Bill That Worried Investors

description: The President-elect says he’ll end the war in Ukraine. Europe is confronting the reality it will have to step up if the US cuts back support for Kyiv — but that won’t be easy.
title: A Trump-Sized Hole Is Looming in Ukraine’s Defenses Against Putin

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, US economy editor Matthew Boesler looks at how a favorite benchmark for Trump affects inflation. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump May Think Twice About Cheering Markets as Inflation Sticks

description: Democrat Derek Tran defeated Republican incumbent Michelle Steel in the race for California’s 45th Congressional District, AP projected.
title: Tran Wins House Race in California; Democrats Flip Seat

description: David Lammy said he wants to emulate Donald Trump’s ability to strike a deal as the UK foreign secretary tries to reset relations with the European Union, the latest example of warm words directed at the president-elect despite the threat of US tariffs hanging over British trade policy.
title: Lammy Vows Trump-Style Dealmaking in UK Foreign Secretary Role

description: UK opposition leader Kemi Badenoch said her Conservative Party would introduce a cap on migrant numbers if elected, conceding that the previous Tory government failed to deliver on its promise to reduce numbers.
title: Ousted Tories Say They Would Cap UK Net Migration, Review Human Rights Pact

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he is nominating Keith Kellogg as the special envoy for Ukraine and Russia, enlisting a retired Army general who has called for cutting off military aid to Ukraine.
title: Trump Picks Keith Kellogg for Ukraine, Russia Special Envoy

description: The White House said Ukraine must recruit more soldiers for the war against Russia, including by lowering the draft age, as a lack of manpower rather than weapons is the country’s most pressing need.
title: US Says Ukraine Needs More Troops, Not Only Weapons, to Win War

description: President-Elect Donald Trump will go up against a familiar adversary as he prepares to fulfill campaign promises of a swift rollback of Biden-era policies and an aggressive execution of his own agenda: The grind of the US legal system.
title: Trump Agenda Set to Collide With Slow Pace of US Legal System

description: Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama is consulting with public schools about banning TikTok and Snapchat, calling social media networks threats to children’s safety.
title: Albanian Premier Considers Banning TikTok and Snapchat

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s transition team has interviewed Paul Atkins, a veteran financial regulator and eminence grise of conservative financial circles, as a candidate to lead the US Securities and Exchange Commission, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Team Eyes Atkins, Ex-SEC Commissioner, to Succeed Gensler

description: Some of President-elect Donald Trump’s cabinet nominees were harassed by bomb threats and hoax phone calls, his transition team said Wednesday.
title: Trump Transition Says Cabinet Picks Targeted by Bomb Threats

description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva wants to present a plan for income tax exemptions alongside public spending cuts, as investors grow increasingly worried over the nation’s fiscal policy.
title: Brazil’s Lula Seeks Income Tax Exemptions Along With Public Spending Cuts

description: Marine Le Pen, leader of France’s far-right National Rally party, will learn in March whether she faces a ban from running in the nation’s next presidential race.
title: Le Pen Will Learn in March If She’s Banned From Next French Presidential Race

description: Kenya’s High Court blocked the government from entering into a new concession for the nation’s main airport, a week after President William Ruto scrapped a deal with India’s Adani Group.
title: Kenyan Court Blocks Government From Concessioning Main Airport

description: The US sanctioned 21 officials it said supported Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro’s effort to defy results of an election that the country’s opposition and Washington say he lost.
title: US Sanctions More Maduro Aides After Alleging Election Theft

description: Massive job losses and more expensive pickup trucks: That’s what the steep tariffs Donald Trump is threatening to slap on his neighbors will mean for the US, according to Mexico’s government.
title: Mexico Warns Trump His Steep Tariffs Will Hammer the US Economy

description: Billionaire Elon Musk called for eliminating the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, highlighting the renewed threat under President-elect Donald Trump to a regulatory agency that has long been a target of Republicans and business advocacy groups.
title: Musk Calls for Abolishing Consumer Finance Agency: ‘Delete CFPB’

description: Romanian President Klaus Iohannis called a meeting of the Supreme Defense Council to review the risks of potential interference after the shock victory of a pro-Russian candidate in the first round of presidential elections Sunday.
title: Romania Calls Defense Meeting Over Election Meddling Risk

description: A coalition of seven European Union member states is calling for actions to preserve the competitiveness of the bloc’s automotive industry at a time when it needs to invest in innovation to comply with the stricter emissions limits.
title: Italy, Poland Urge EU to Spare Carmakers From Emissions Fines

description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico said he will go to Moscow next year to attend celebrations marking the 80th anniversary of victory in World War II.
title: Slovakia’s Fico to Join Putin for WWII Celebrations in Moscow

description: Tanzanians voted in local government elections on Wednesday that the main opposition said was rigged after thousands of its candidates were disqualified from running.
title: Tanzanians Vote in Local Elections Opposition Says Is Rigged

description: The tectonic plates of how Europe gets and pays for gas from Russia are moving.
title: European Gas Buyers Rush to Find Workaround to US Sanctions

description: The US Commodity Futures Trading Commission, the underfunded regulator overshadowed by the SEC, has a path to prominence if the incoming Trump administration revamps crypto policy and installs an industry-leaning chair.
title: Trump’s Embrace of Crypto Poised to Increase CFTC’s Power Over Industry

description: Far-right leader Marine Le Pen’s finance chief said Wednesday her lawmakers have not yet decided if they will vote to bring down the French government in a no-confidence motion over the budget.
title: Le Pen’s Party Yet to Decide on Toppling French Government

description: Mozambique faces three more days of protests called by an opposition leader, after he skipped a meeting with the other candidates in last month’s disputed presidential election.
title: Mozambique Election Protests Resume After Leaders’ Meeting Flops

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Lebanon Cease-Fire Is No Guarantee of Wider Peace

description: Polish authorities arrested a German citizen on charges of brokering and exporting dual-use goods to Russia.
title: Poland Arrests German Citizen Over Goods Exports to Russia

description: The owner of an English coastal tourist attraction designed by the architects of the London Eye is racing to find a rescue buyer to avoid closing, after defaulting on £50 million ($63 million) of debt.
title: Brighton’s Seaside Viewing Tower at Risk of Closing Over Debts

description: Namibians lined up from late Tuesday to vote in presidential and parliamentary elections that are expected to be the sternest test yet for the party that has led the sparsely populated southeast African nation since independence in 1990.
title: Namibians Vote in Sternest Test Yet for Swapo’s 35-Year Rule

description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said Kyiv has agreed to allow the exhumation of ethnic Poles killed in World War II massacres, clearing the path to resolve a rift between the two countries.
title: Poland Signals Breakthrough in Feud With Ukraine That Put EU Ambitions at Risk

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping has devoted billions of dollars to his aim of transforming the military into a modern force by 2027. His government has also launched sweeping purges in the upper echelons of the People’s Liberation Army in response to what US intelligence believes to be widespread corruption undermining Xi’s ambitions. A major concern for Beijing appears to be graft that has eroded the quality of the weapons and capabilities of units such as the Rocket Force, which oversees the coun
title: Why Is China Purging Some of Its Most Senior Military Leaders?

description: Ukrainian Defense Minister Rustem Umerov is in South Korea on a trip widely viewed as seeking weapons supplies from Seoul to help Kyiv repel a Russian invasion now backed by North Korea.
title: Zelenskiy Sends Envoy to Seoul as Kyiv Seeks Weapons Support

description: Poland will propose a maritime policing program in the Baltic Sea similar to air-monitoring missions that are being carried out by NATO members, Prime Minister Donald Tusk said on Wednesday.
title: Tusk Proposes Navy Policing in the Baltic Sea Amid Russia Threat

description: Georgia’s ruling party chose Mikheil Kavelashvili, a former soccer player and current lawmaker, to be their presidential candidate in the Dec. 14 election to replace the country’s current pro-Europe head of state.
title: Georgian Ruling Party Proposes Ex-Football Player for President

description: The Philippine police has filed complaints against Vice President Sara Duterte and her aides for alleged assault and coercion during a recent incident in Congress.
title: Philippine Police File Assault, Other Charges Against VP Duterte

description: A cease-fire between Israel and the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah started early Wednesday, after the sides reached a deal following weeks of US-mediated talks.
title: Lebanon Cease-Fire Starts After Israel and Hezbollah Reach Deal

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s pick for the top trade position sees China as a “generational challenge” to the US and has advocated for a strategic decoupling from the country.
title: Trump’s Trade Chief Advocates ‘Strategic Decoupling’ From China

description: Vietnam plans to buy more aircraft, liquefied natural gas and other products from the US as government officials brace for a new era of tariffs from the incoming Trump administration.
title: Vietnam Vows to Buy More US Aircraft, LNG in New Tariff Era

description: As recent extreme weather in the UK and Spain has shown, leaders can’t hide from global warming — and there are potential repercussions for those who try to.
title: Politicians Can’t Escape the Floodwaters

description: Europe’s worst-case scenario for the future of transatlantic economic relations rose to the surface this week when President-elect Donald Trump gave a clear signal that he’ll use American trade might as a means to exert foreign policy leverage.
title: Europe Awaits Trump Tariff Clash With Its Own New Trade Powers

description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen is about to get her new team in place, just in time to prepare for the return of Donald Trump.
title: EU’s New Team Poised to Inherit Big Challenge: Taking on Trump

description: President elect Donald Trump nominated health policy researcher Jay Bhattacharya to head the US National Institutes of Health, the sprawling agency that oversees close to $50 billion in basic biomedical research spending.
title: Trump Picks Stanford Critic of Covid-Era Lockdowns to Head NIH

description: Malaysia’s High Court dropped one of the cases against former Prime Minister Najib Razak related to troubled state fund 1MDB, the New Straits Times reported Wednesday.
title: Malaysia Court Drops One 1MDB Case Against Najib, NST Says

description: Indian billionaire Gautam Adani and his aides have not been charged under the US Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, an Adani Group entity said, seeking to clarify some media reports claiming so.
title: Gautam Adani Not Charged With Violating US FCPA, Group Says

description: President-elect Donald Trump named Kevin Hassett to direct the National Economic Council and Jamieson Greer as the US Trade Representative, filling two key posts on his economic team.
title: Trump Names Hassett to Top Economic Role, Greer as Trade Chief

description: US officials believe China has placed its current defense chief under investigation for corruption, the Financial Times reports — in what would be the latest shocking development roiling the world’s largest military by number of personnel.
title: China Defense Minister Investigated for Corruption, FT Reports

description: President-elect Donald Trump has threatened tariffs of 25% on imports from Canada and Mexico until fentanyl and undocumented migrants stop flowing over US borders.
title: Canada Feels Trump’s Wrath Over Drugs, Migrants and Pledges Tougher Stance

description: President-elect Donald Trump is tapping Vince Haley to head the White House Domestic Policy Council, an influential post responsible for coordinating his agenda across major federal agencies.
title: Trump Names Vince Haley to Lead White House Domestic Agenda

description: Vietnamese prosecutors have told property tycoon Truong My Lan she must repay an estimated $11 billion if she wants to avoid execution by lethal injection.
title: Vietnam Mogul Told to Refund Missing Billions to Save Her Life
